full_summary:
=================
### Announceement: Request for Proposal

#### New Haven Wharf Repair

**Procurement Reference Number:** cb-804-61831576

**Request for Proposal Number:** 30005198

**Contracting Authority:** Department of Fisheries and Oceans

#### Project Description

The project entails the stabilization of structures 401 and 402, and the removal and disposal of structure 403 at New Haven, Victoria County, Nova Scotia.

**Conditional Set-Aside for Indigenous Companies**

This Request for Proposal is open to all qualified contractors. However, the Department of Fisheries and Oceans reserves the right to limit the competition to Indigenous companies certified under the Procurement Strategy for Indigenous Business (PSIB) if two or more compliant bids from Indigenous companies have been received. If this condition is met, non-Indigenous contractors will not be considered.

#### Tender Details

* **Tender Closing Date:** 20 December 2023
* **Expected Contract Start Date:** 25 December 2023
* **Expected Contract End Date:** 30 April 2024
* **Trade Agreements:** Canadian Free Trade Agreement (CFTA)
* **Regions:** Canada, with delivery in Nova Scotia
* **Tender Method:** Competitive - Open Bidding
* **Evaluation Criteria:** Lowest Price

#### Attachments

Attachments are available for download on the [Canada Buys website](https://canadabuys.canada.ca/?language=en).

* Annex C: Specifications
* Annex D: Drawings
* ITT Final: English Version
* ITT Final: French Version
* Addendum 1: Addenda Editing Changes

#### Contact Information

* Dina Al-Eryani, Tendering Authority
	+ Email: <Dina.Al-Eryani@dfo-mpo.gc.ca>
	+ Phone: (506) 282-2340

#### Notes

Please ensure your company is registered in the Indigenous Business Directory if you wish to be considered for this Conditional Set-Aside. The full Request for Proposal and attachment details are available on the [Canada Buys website](https://canadabuys.canada.ca/?language=en). 

This Project is made accessible owing to the commitment of the Department of Fisheries and Oceans to support the Indigenous industry in Nova Scotia. We do encourage, Indigenous suppliers, to respond.
